Issue.Title: Generate and verify row_hmacs when creating and retrieving secrets
Issue.Description:
In reference to issue #182, we are adding a new column to clients, secrets, accessgrants, memberships, and secrets_content to protect against db admins tampering with the database. We generate an hmac for each of these tables to ensure that data can't be tampered without access to the private key.
Instead of auto-incrementing id's we generate random 64 bit id's which are concatenated with the other identifying columns in each respective table (ie. for client we use the name column and for secrets_content we use the encrypted content). This value is then hmac'd, stored, and verified whenever a secret is retrieved.
The hmac verification is only guaranteed on Secret(s)DeliveryResource. Other locations are either admin endpoints or only show secret details and not actual secret content.
This change will not affect users beyond having to set a new flag in the config. Setting **rowHmacCheck** to disabled will turn off row_hmac verification. The row_hmac column will still be set even if this flag is disabled. A future PR will add backfills to generate row_hmacs for prior database entries. The migration will default to an empty string and with **rowHmacCheck** disabled, this should not affect keywhiz operations.

Issue.Title: Error: unsupported attribute "proxy_configuration" on aws_ecs_task_definition after migration
Issue.Description:
<!--- Please note the following potential times when an issue might be in Terraform core:
* [Configuration Language](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/index.html) or resource ordering issues * [State](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/index.html) and [State Backend](https://www.terraform.io/docs/backends/index.html) issues * [Provisioner](https://www.terraform.io/docs/provisioners/index.html) issues * [Registry](https://registry.terraform.io/) issues * Spans resources across multiple providers
If you are running into one of these scenarios, we recommend opening an issue in the [Terraform core repository](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/) instead. --->
<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->
### Community Note
* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request * Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request * If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment
<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->
### Terraform Version
<!--- Please run `terraform -v` to show the Terraform core version and provider version(s). If you are not running the latest version of Terraform or the provider, please upgrade because your issue may have already been fixed. [Terraform documentation on provider versioning](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/providers.html#provider-versions). --->
``` Terraform v0.12.5 + provider.aws v2.8.0 + provider.external v1.1.2 ``` (migrating from Terraform v0.11.14)
### Affected Resource(s)
* aws_ecs_task_definition
### Terraform Configuration Files
<!--- Information about code formatting: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#quoting-code --->
```hcl resource "aws_ecs_task_definition" "kibanacfg" { family = "kibanacfg" container_definitions = <<CONTAINER [ { "name": "kibanacfg", "image": "${var.kibanacfg_repo}:${var.kibanacfg_tag}", "cpu": 256, "memory": 512, "essential": true, "command": ["load", "all"], "environment": [ { "name": "UPOWR_ENV", "value": "${var.environment}" }, { "name": "USE_AWS_PROFILE", "value": "false" } ], "links": [], "portMappings": [], "mountPoints": [], "volumesFrom": [], "logConfiguration": { "logDriver": "awslogs", "options": { "awslogs-group": "${var.environment}", "awslogs-region": "${var.region}", "awslogs-stream-prefix": "${var.log_prefix}" } } } ] CONTAINER
network_mode = "awsvpc"
# execution_role_arn - (Optional) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task execution role that the Amazon ECS container agent and the Docker daemon can assume. execution_role_arn = "arn:aws:iam::${data.aws_caller_identity.current.account_id}:role/ecsTaskExecutionRole"
# task_role_arn - (Optional) The ARN of IAM role that allows your Amazon ECS container task to make calls to other AWS services. task_role_arn = aws_iam_role.kibanacfg_task.arn
cpu = 256 memory = 512 tags = { terraform = true environment = var.environment } requires_compatibilities = ["FARGATE"] }
```
### Debug Output
<!--- Please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the complete debug output. Please do NOT paste the debug output in the issue; just paste a link to the Gist.
To obtain the debug output, see the [Terraform documentation on debugging](https://www.terraform.io/docs/internals/debugging.html). --->
Full output: https://gist.github.com/jonseymour/21f32ba82b1b7337fa9d246daf0426a0
grep of the relevant lines
``` 2019/07/31 23:35:08 [ERROR] module.kibanacfg: eval: *terraform.EvalReadState, err: unsupported attribute "proxy_configuration" 2019/07/31 23:35:08 [ERROR] module.kibanacfg: eval: *terraform.EvalSequence, err: unsupported attribute "proxy_configuration" Error: unsupported attribute "proxy_configuration" ```
### Panic Output
<!--- If Terraform produced a panic, please provide a link to a GitHub Gist containing the output of the `crash.log`. --->
### Expected Behavior
Plan succeeds.
### Actual Behavior
Plan fails with `unsupported attribute "proxy_configuration"` for an attribute which isn't actually used anywhere in the text of the module.
<!--- What actually happened? --->
### Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Please list the steps required to reproduce the issue. --->
1. using 0.11.14 create a standalone `aws_ecs_task_definition` resource 2. upgrade to 0.12.5 using the `terraform 0.12upgrade` tool 3 run `terraform plan`
### Important Factoids
<!--- Are there anything atypical about your accounts that we should know? For example: Running in EC2 Classic? ---> This was noticed during the first attempt to plan following an upgrade from 0.11.14. It happened for two different `aws_ecs_task_definition` resources in two different modules. Only one is shown here. There are other `aws_ecs_task_definition` resources in the full plan and the problem did not occur for the other definitions.
What seems unique about the two failing modules is that these modules have `aws_ecs_task_definitions` resources which are not linked to parent `aws_ecs_service` resources because they are worker tasks that do not need a service listener.
A workaround seems to be to perform a `terraform state rm` and then a `terraform import` for the affected resources.
### References
<!--- Information about referencing Github Issues: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#referencing-issues-and-pull-requests
Are there any other GitHub issues (open or closed) or pull requests that should be linked here? Vendor documentation? For example: --->
* #0000

Issue.Title: Enforce Quorum in Governance
Issue.Description:
### Description
Adds quorum condition in Governance, restricting the passing of proposals with low participation. Tracks a quorum baseline, which tends toward the network participation of recent proposals. Proposals whose participation does not meet the baseline are filled to that level with "no" votes, requiring significantly higher support among the voters who participated to pass.
The proposal struct is updated with the current total network weight when `approve()` or `vote()` is called. This ensures that any approved proposal will have a total weight set, even if no votes are cast. At execution and participation baseline update, this value is used for the network weight when computing participation.
### Tested
Adds Governance and Quorum unit tests.
### Other changes
Changes the default proposal threshold from a simple majority to a 70% supermajority. Reasoning was that until the network agrees on what the threshold for a type of proposal should be, it should be no easier to pass it than it is to pass a proposal to lower its threshold.
Decouples certain Governance functions with proposal struct inputs into external/private versions to save gas. Fixes a mistake in the Integration: Governance tests.
### Related issues
- Fixes https://github.com/celo-org/celo-monorepo/issues/183
### Backwards compatibility
TBD

Issue.Title: Track elapsed time more accurately with monotonic_time()
Issue.Description:
http://erlang.org/doc/apps/erts/time_correction.html#Dos_and_Donts_Measure_Elapsed_Time
New guidance using the Time APIs in Erlang suggest using monotonic_time() for Start and End, doing the math, then converting to the unit of time desired.
`kz_time:start_time()` returns a tuple {'start_time', monotonic_time()} since `monotonic_time()` just returns a bare integer().
Update elapsed_* and decr_timeout to handle the {'start_time', _} tuple and properly calculate the time difference in the desired units.

Issue.Title: Mynewt: Define logs in packages' syscfg files
Issue.Description:
This is a Mynewt-specific PR.
Defining logs in syscfg files provides a few benefits:
1. Ability to set log level per module at build time. Setting a global log level of 0 (`LOG_LEVEL=0`) might produce an image that is too big. Instead, we can enable debug logging only for the modules we are interested in.
2. Easier to visualize system log configuration (see below).
3. Log modules can be remapped at build time in case of conflicts.
To see the system-wide log configuration, use either of these commands:
``` newt target logcfg brief <target-name> newt target logcfg show <target-name> ```

Issue.Description:
### Bug Fixes

Issue.Title: Different highlighting for quoted literals
Issue.Description:
While I'm at it, I noticed that the literal ``` "foo" ``` is highlighted, whereas ``` 'foo' ``` does not appear to be.
They are both [quoted literals](https://www.w3.org/TR/turtle/#turtle-literals) and so I think it makes sense to have them highlighted in the same time. :-)

Issue.Title: Cannot bundle Pillow using py2app on macOS
Issue.Description:
<!-- Thank you for reporting an issue.
Follow these guidelines to ensure your issue is handled properly.
If you have a ...
1. General question: consider asking the question on Stack Overflow with the python-imaging-library tag:
* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/python-imaging-library
Do not ask a question in both places.
If you think you have found a bug or have an unexplained exception then file a bug report here.
2. Bug report: include a self-contained, copy-pastable example that generates the issue if possible. Be concise with code posted. Guidelines on how to provide a good bug report:
* https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve
Bug reports which follow these guidelines are easier to diagnose, and are often handled much more quickly.
3. Feature request: do a quick search of existing issues to make sure this has not been asked before.
We know asking good questions takes effort, and we appreciate your time. Thank you. -->
### What did you do?
Tried to bundle python apps that use Pillow into a .app bundle on macOS using py2app.
### What did you expect to happen?
A working .app bundle of my Python code would be produced.
### What actually happened?
py2app failed to properly bundle Pillow due to an issue with re-writing the dylib install path when moving the dependency dylibs into the app bundle. The reported error is:
ValueError: New Mach-O header is too large to relocate in '/code/LearningEquality/exelearning/dist/exe.app/Contents/Resources/lib/python2.7/PIL/.dylibs/liblcms2.2.dylib' (new size=1688L, max size=1680L, delta=48L)
I was able to fix this locally by rebuilding Pillow after recompiling the homebrew dependencies with the following added linker flags: `-Wl,-headerpad_max_install_names`
### What are your OS, Python and Pillow versions?
* OS: macOS 10.13.6 * Python: 2.7, 3.4, 3.6 * Pillow: 6.1.0
<!-- Please include **code** that reproduces the issue and whenever possible, an **image** that demonstrates the issue. Please upload images to GitHub, not to third-party file hosting sites. If necessary, add the image to a zip or tar archive.
The best reproductions are self-contained scripts with minimal dependencies. If you are using a framework such as Plone, Django, or Buildout, try to replicate the issue just using Pillow. -->
I could work on a reproducible app if needed, but it would need at least two files, a setup.py file and a main.py that imports pillow, so would probably upload a zip somewhere. If the code for installing the brew dependencies on macOS are in the repo, would be happy to submit a PR with the fix.

Issue.Title: Begin Google Doc Report
Make Developer Portal More Mobile Friendly
Issue.Description:
It'd be nice if the design of the Developer Portal was more mobile friendly.
On mobile devices the navigation menu is cut-off (see below screenshot).
The Developer Portal is also missing a [responsive meta tag](https://css-tricks.com/snippets/html/responsive-meta-tag/) so it appears "zoomed-out" on mobile devices.
```html <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"> ```
The **APIs** and **Admin Panel** pages will be trickier to make mobile-friendly, but I don't necessarily care if they're mobile friendly to start.
The Home Page and navigation menu seem more important to make responsive.
Thoughts?

Issue.Title: Improve RSS sorting
Issue.Description:
Currently some podcast clients have issues displaying LibriVox recordings in the correct order, this is presumably because you don't have `pubDate` like standard podcasts.
However LibriVox can provide `section_number` as the episode number so podcast clients can use that to sort.
I have also added iTunes `type` = `serial`, this is used to identify podcasts where order is important, apposed to the majority of podcasts where they are time relevant, and the latest episode is emphasised. This should help compatible podcast clients prompt the user to listen from the start, in the correct order.
NOTE: It looks fine to me but I don't have a PHP environment set up so I can't test this. The only potential issue I can see would be `section_number` as I don't fully understand the objects in this project. But I'm fairly confidant this should work fine.

Issue.Title: Support cyclic types when using collections
Issue.Description:
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/39769
Changes the behavior to not call `JsonSerializerOptions.JsonClassInfo GetOrAddClass(Type classType)` during warm-up of collections. Previously the code protected against `StackOverflowException` due to circular type references but not for collections (only properties that returned an object directly).
The warm-up code should only use `JsonClassInfo` for the actual root type being deserialized, and not any child properties -- just the `System.Type` is remembered for those. Later at run-time, the `JsonClassInfo` can be obtained from that `System.Type` and cached without causing any circular issues.

Issue.Title: Cannot un-pickle a pickled Operation instance 🥒
Issue.Description:
Hey, I'm using sgqlc to introspect a schema and then generate queries from it and it is going well. However, I'm trying to parallelize tasks that contain an operation, which requires pickling it inside the task.
Here is the traceback that arises when trying to deserialize the (successfully) serialized op: ``` Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/myuser/myproj/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sgqlc/types/__init__.py", line 657, in __getattr__ return self.__kinds[key] # .type, .scalar, etc... File "/Users/myuser/myproj/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sgqlc/types/__init__.py", line 657, in __getattr__ return self.__kinds[key] # .type, .scalar, etc... File "/Users/myuser/myproj/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sgqlc/types/__init__.py", line 657, in __getattr__ return self.__kinds[key] # .type, .scalar, etc... [Previous line repeated 486 more times] RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object ```
I can reproduce this like so (using the generated python schema from sgqlc): ```python import my_python_schema from cloudpickle import dumps, loads
schema_query = my_python_schema.Query op = Operation(schema_query)
pickled_op = dumps(op) # works unpickled_op = loads(pickled_op) # blows up with traceback above ```
Are there any options I'm missing that could maybe pre-flatten the types or specify the max depth?
Thanks for the sweet project 🙂

Issue.Title: Remove query from response per RFC 6762
Issue.Description:
This is intended to be merged after #8 so that the only commit is the final one:
Remove query from response per RFC 6762
Section 6 says:
Multicast DNS responses MUST NOT contain any questions in the Question Section. Any questions in the Question Section of a received Multicast DNS response MUST be silently ignored. Multicast DNS queriers receiving Multicast DNS responses do not care what question elicited the response; they care only that the information in the response is true and accurate.
This fixes an issue where mDNS worked when queried from OSX, but didn't work when queried from Linux (presumably not all versions of Linux).

Issue.Title: Menu roles "zoomin" and "zoomout" do nothing
Issue.Description:
<!-- As an open source project with a dedicated but small maintainer team, it can sometimes take a long time for issues to be addressed so please be patient and we will get back to you as soon as we can. -->
### Preflight Checklist <!-- Please ensure you've completed the following steps by replacing [ ] with [x]-->
* [x] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project. * [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to. * [x] I have searched the issue tracker for an issue that matches the one I want to file, without success.
### Issue Details
* **Electron Version: 5.0.8** * **Operating System: Windows 10 (17763) **
### Expected Behavior For the default menu options "Zoom in", "Zoom out", and "Actual Size" (which have the roles "zoomin", "zoomout", and "resetzoom", respectively), I expect them to zoom my app.
### Actual Behavior They take no action whatsoever. No zooming in or out. However, zoom is still properly affected by manually running webFrame.setZoomFactor(x).
### To Reproduce Just created a most basic electron app (just loads a single page that says "Tab" in h1 tags). Zoom does not work. Check out my Electron Fiddle to see what I mean:
https://gist.github.com/bf259939ce78c089f21294de95844b95

Issue.Title: CMake and CI
Issue.Description:
See the PR #3
CMake convention is to use `build` folder as output folder (for build artifacts).
`azure-sdk-for-c` will contain multiple project. We do have two options:
1. every project should have its own `build/` folder. ``` cd sdk/storage/storage/ mkdir build cd build cmake .. cmake --build .. ``` Or ``` cmake -S sdk/storage/storage -B sdk/storage/storage/build cmake --build sdk/storage/storage/build ``` Or ``` cd sdk/storage/storage/ cmake -S . -B build/ cmake --build build/ ``` 1. we use one global `build/` folder. How do build multiple projects into the same `build/` folder?

Sort Lines Ascending / Descending sorts differently on comments than on code.
Issue.Description:
- VSCode Version: 1.36.1 - OS Version: Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Copy paste this code in to VSCode: ``` /** * !description Properties of type {string} consist of: * *
    *
  • USER_DATE
    • *
  • USER_ADMIN
    • *
  • USER_PASSWORD
    • *
  • USER
    • *
  • USER_EMAIL
    • *
  • USER_TOKEN
    • *
  • USER_NAME
    • *
* * !public * !constant * */ const Model = { USER_DATE: "date", USER_ADMIN: "admin", USER: "user", USER_EMAIL: "email", USER_PASSWORD: "password", USER_NAME: "name", USER_TOKEN: "token", }; ``` 2. Highlight both the list elements in the documentation and the object entries in the Model constant. 3. Open the Command Palette (F1 or Ctrl + Shift + P). 4. Type "sort" to filter the commands and select "Sort Lines Ascending" (or descending). 5. Notice the ascended (or descended) sorting is different in the documentation than in the code. Specifically, `
  • USER
    • ` appears first in the documentation but `USER: "user"` appears last in the code: ``` /** * !description Properties of type {string} consist of: * *
      *
    • USER
      • *
    • USER_ADMIN
      • *
    • USER_DATE
      • *
    • USER_EMAIL
      • *
    • USER_NAME
      • *
    • USER_PASSWORD
      • *
    • USER_TOKEN
      • *
    * * !public * !constant * */ const Model = { USER_ADMIN: "admin", USER_DATE: "date", USER_EMAIL: "email", USER_NAME: "name", USER_PASSWORD: "password", USER_TOKEN: "token", USER: "user", }; ``` Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Issue.Title: [doc] Update TROUBLESHOOTING.md: "cannot find -lLLVMCore"
Issue.Description:
The issue occurs when LLVM is compiled as one big shared library:
``` /usr/bin/clang++ -fPIC -fvisibility-inlines-hidden -std=c++11 -w -fdiagnostics-color -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections -O3 -DNDEBUG frontend/llvm/CMakeFiles/ikos-import.dir/src/ikos_import.cpp.o -o frontend/llvm/ikos-import frontend/llvm/libikos-llvm-to-ar.a -lLLVMCore -lLLVMipo -lLLVMIRReader -lLLVMSupport -lLLVMTransformUtils ar/libikos-ar.a /usr/lib64/libboost_filesystem.so /usr/lib64/libboost_system.so /usr/lib64/libgmp.so /usr/lib64/libgmpxx.so && : /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lLLVMCore /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lLLVMipo /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lLLVMIRReader /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lLLVMSupport /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lLLVMTransformUtils ```
See also: 54500c4fa5ceda972ac1efc5b4ce9c9813384cca

Issue.Title: Added min and mean + Added N input support for max
Issue.Description:
This PR adds the min and mean layer and also adds support for these layer and the max layer layer to have N inputs instead of just two.
I also moved the `convert_max` to `elementwise_layers` as they are elementwise operations.

Issue.Title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Add an option for "convex raft"
Issue.Description:
### Version 2.0.0
### Feature Requested Add option to create convex rafts (for example - have the first layer of the raft fill the entirety of the skirt).
### Justification Some materials are prone to curling - when using a raft to try to achieve a successful print the printhead may trip on the raft itself due to curling.
This can be prevented if the raft had no internal voids/gaps for the printhead to trip on.

Issue.Title: Incomplete composer query response for get_entity_id_from_vanity_name
Issue.Description:
In `get_entity_id_from_vanity_name` I was frequently getting an empty list back in `json_response['payload']['entries']`, so I inspected the json and noticed the `lid` key. I tried using that when there weren't any `'entries'`, and everything worked like magic - something like:
``` if not json_response['payload']['entries']: return json_response['lid'] ```
Not sure if anyone else is having this issue, but thought I would post anyway.
Thanks so much for creating this!

Issue.Title: Store Order Type in State - Mobile
Issue.Description:
When a user selects "delivery" or "pick-up", this choice should be stored in state. The only time the user should have this option is when there is no existing order. If there is an existing order, then the order navigation option should take you to the category selection screen.
We can include this selection in the request to the api as well and I will configure the API to add it to to the document tomorrow.
``` JSON { "actor": DEVICE_ID, "action": "api.codeScanned" or "api.itemAdded", "code": sku or barcode, "orderType": "pickup" or "delivery" } ```

Issue.Title: Getting Started with GitHub
Issue.Description:
## Welcome to your repository!
In this repository <sup>[:book:](https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary/#repository)</sup>, you’ll learn how to write with Markdown <sup>[:book:](https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary/#markdown)</sup>, a simple and widely used markup language for formatting text. Here, you’ll start building a static webpage for your customized portfolio.
### What is Markdown?
Markdown is a lightweight syntax for communicating on GitHub, and many other websites. You can format words as **bold** or _italic_, add images, and create lists. Markdown is regular text combined with a few non-alphabetic symbols, such as `#` or `*`. You can use Markdown with the formatting toolbar in issues <sup>[:book:](https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary/#issues)</sup> and pull requests <sup>[:book:](https://help.github.com/articles/github-glossary/#pull-request)</sup>, or you can type the syntax.
You can use Markdown most places around GitHub:
- Comments in issues and pull requests (like this one!) - Files with the `.md` or `.markdown` extension - Sharing snippets of text in [Gists](https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-gists)
For more information, see “[Writing on GitHub](https://help.github.com/categories/writing-on-github/)” in the _GitHub Help_.
Let's get started!

Issue.Title: Weird positioning and UI if Pageboy nested in Tabman
Issue.Description:
### New Issue Checklist
- [x] Updated Tabman to the latest version - [x] I took a look at the [Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/uias/Tabman/blob/master/Docs/Troubleshooting.md) - [x] I searched for [existing GitHub issues](https://github.com/uias/Tabman/issues)
### Issue Description
This is most likely a very special case and very complicated. I'm not sure if it's somewhat related to #391 but I'll go ahead and describe the issue as thoroughly as I can, first:
So first things first, I am using a `PageboyViewController` nested in a `TabmanViewController` so inside the `TabmanViewController` I have 2 view controllers: `[PageboyController(), NormalViewController()]`. The navigation bar is hidden and the scroll orientation of the `PageboyController` is vertical whereas the orientation of the latter (`PageboyViewController`) is horizontal. I am currently just trying a few things out so both controllers only use 2 view controllers. Both controllers in the `PageboyController` are `NormalViewController`s.
So now what I am trying to achieve: I would like the `PageboyViewController` to be the default page of the `TabmanViewController`. Therefore, my default page in this controller is set to `.first`. However, I want the second `NormalViewController` in my `PageboyController` to be the default. Accordingly, in the `PageboyController` the default page is set to `.last` or `.at(index: 1)`.
The actual issue: I noticed 2 odd behaviors.
1. The first was that I had to set the default page in the `PageboyController` to `.first` and call `scrollToPage(.last, animated: false)` in the `viewDidLoad` in order to realize what I was trying to achieve (default page should actually be `.last` in the `PageboyController`). This was a pretty weird workaround, nonetheless, it solved the problem for now and I didn't wanna bother you if I found a workaround. 2. However, now I implemented some UI in the `NormalViewController` of my `PageboyController` and i.a. push a view controller using a `UIButton` which is part of this UI. When I go back now, though, the first page I now see is `.first`. As soon as I try to scroll now it jumps back to the actually wanted page `.last`. If I did this once now, this issue doesn't occur anymore which makes it even weirder.
Moreover, I let the position be printed out in the console and see some even weirder behavior. The code I am using to just print it is the following:
`
func pageboyViewController(_ pageboyViewController: PageboyViewController, willScrollToPageAt index: PageboyViewController.PageIndex, direction: PageboyViewController.NavigationDirection, animated: Bool) { print("vertical ProfilePageboy willScrollToPageAt index:", index) }
func pageboyViewController(_ pageboyViewController: PageboyViewController, didReloadWith currentViewController: UIViewController, currentPageIndex: PageboyViewController.PageIndex) { print("vertical ProfilePageboy didReloadWith currentPageIndex:", currentPageIndex) }
func defaultPage(for pageboyViewController: PageboyViewController) -> PageboyViewController.Page? { print("vertical ProfilePageboy defaultPage: .first") return .at(index: 0) }
func pageboyViewController(_ pageboyViewController: PageboyViewController, didScrollTo position: CGPoint, direction: PageboyViewController.NavigationDirection, animated: Bool) {
print("position", position.y) `
This is what I get when I open the controller ("|" because somehow new lines aren't shown): `vertical ProfilePageboy defaultPage: .first | vertical ProfilePageboy didScrollToPageAt: 0 | vertical ProfilePageboy didReloadWith currentPageIndex: 0 | vertical ProfilePageboy defaultPage: .first | vertical ProfilePageboy didScrollToPageAt: 0 | vertical ProfilePageboy didReloadWith currentPageIndex: 0 | vertical ProfilePageboy willScrollToPageAt index: 1 | vertical ProfilePageboy willScrollToPageAt index: 1 | position -1.0 | position 0.0 | vertical ProfilePageboy didScrollToPageAt: 1 | position 1.0 | vertical ProfilePageboy didScrollToPageAt: 1 | position 1.0 `
If I then open a new view controller using the `UIButton` and then go back, I get: `position -0.11206896551724138`. (The page I see is `.first`. Going back to `.last` again and reapeating this will lead to the page I will see being `.last` again and it isn't `.first` anymore.)
1. If I now scroll up (such that I go) further in the direction `.first`, I get the following: `vertical ProfilePageboy didScrollToPageAt: 0 | vertical ProfilePageboy willScrollToPageAt index: 0 | position -0.11863711001642041 | ... values between above and below ... | position -0.0008210180623973261 | position -0.00041050903119873303 | position 0.0 ` 2. If I scroll down, I get: `position -0.11124794745484405 | position 0.888752052545156 | position 0.8895730706075534 | ... values between above and below ... | position 0.9975369458128078 | position 0.9991789819376027 | position 1.0008210180623973 | vertical ProfilePageboy willScrollToPageAt index: 1 | position 1.0024630541871922 | position 1.0041050903119868 | position 1.0053366174055829 | ... values between above and below ... | position 1.2582101806239736 | position 1.2766830870279147 (maximum scroll down) | position 1.0 (going back to 1.0 itself) `
To scroll back one has to very exhaustingly scroll whilst swiping from the very bottom to the top.
Do you have any idea why this is occurring and how I could fix this? If I only use the `PageboyController` this doesn't occur.
### Other useful things
I have some assumptions on this but I am not sure if I'm right so I would love to hear your opinion on this:
- `position -0.11863711001642041` (the value I get after going back from the viewcontroller I can go to via the UIButton of the `NormalViewController`) is constant and I'm guessing it has to do with the height of the tab bar at the top of the screen. - the position seems to be messed up due to some interference between the `TabmanViewController` & `PageboyController` but I am not sure how.
<!--- Images, stack traces or any other things that you think would be useful! -->

Issue.Title: Broad shield rebalance.
Issue.Description:
:cl: tweak: The shield generator has been reworked. It is now much more expensive to keep the shields on continuously, and for large shields it's likely not viable. rscadd: The shield generator now has an idle and active state (as well as the off state). In the idle state, it consumes limited power and does not generate a shield. In the active state, it consumes a lot of power and produces a shield. rscadd: If an idle generator is toggled on, it takes a short amount of time to spin up to active state. If an active generator is toggled to idle, it will switch to that state instantly. rscadd: There are several levels of idle power usage that can be selected. Higher power usage decreases the spin-up time proportionately. rscadd: The shield generator takes time to adjust the radius of the shield. The radius will not be adjusted while the shield is active. tweak: The shield generator's power storage has been vastly expanded. tweak: The shield generator's field integrity is now tracked separately from the power storage (it's determined by the amount of power stored, up to a threshold). /:cl:
General idea: this encourages active usage, and also gives a power sink for engineering shenanigans. With overmap shuttles relatively developed, the requirement for the Torch to be overmap-mobile early in the round is greatly diminished; at the same time, with reasonable active usage, it's likely still possible to turn the shield on while passing impassible obstacles at around the same time it's usually turned on now.
On the other hand, using shields to bypass random events and such by keeping them always on is extremely difficult now.
There are many numbers here which may need tweaking.

Issue.Title: T202TestSpring
Issue.Description:
applicationContext： <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:p="http://www.springframework.org/schema/p" xmlns:aop="http://www.springframework.org/schema/aop" xmlns:tx="http://www.springframework.org/schema/tx" xmlns:context="http://www.springframework.org/schema/context" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans-3.2.xsd http://www.springframework.org/schema/aop http://www.springframework.org/schema/aop/spring-aop-3.2.xsd http://www.springframework.org/schema/context http://www.springframework.org/schema/context/spring-context-3.2.xsd http://www.springframework.org/schema/tx http://www.springframework.org/schema/tx/spring-tx-3.2.xsd ">
<bean class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer" > <property name="location" value="classpath:database.properties"></property> </bean>
<bean id="dataSource" class="org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource" destroy-method="close"> <property name="driverClassName" value="${driver}"></property> <property name="url" value="${url}"></property> <property name="username" value="${username}"></property> <property name="password" value="${password}"/> </bean>
<bean id="sqlSessionFactory" class="org.mybatis.spring.SqlSessionFactoryBean"> <property name="dataSource" ref="dataSource"></property> <property name="configLocation" value="classpath:mybatis-config.xml"></property> </bean>

<context:component-scan base-package="service"/>

<tx:annotation-driven/> </beans>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE configuration PUBLIC "-//mybatis.org//DTD Config 3.0//EN" "http://mybatis.org/dtd/mybatis-3-config.dtd"> <configuration> <!--类型别名 --> <typeAliases> <package name="entity" /> </typeAliases> </configuration>

Issue.Title: final tweaks to order placed page
Port scanning does not work on Windows
Issue.Description:
Repro: In one command prompt, launch `tensorboard --logdir logs1`; in another, launch `tensorboard --logdir logs2`.
Expected behavior: Both TensorBoards launch, one on port 6006 and the other on port 6007. Both can be reached at their expected endpoints.
Actual behavior: Both TensorBoards launch on port 6006. All requests to that port go to the first TensorBoard until it is closed, at which point they go to the second TensorBoard.

Issue.Title: Issues after applying Nvidia Shield upgrade 8 (Android 9 Pie)
Issue.Description: Before the upgrade Jellyfin in the Nvidia Shiled was working as expected. After the upgrade the first issue I got is that I couldn't login, I tried to put the IP address manually and the message was always "Server Unavailable". I have Jellyfin published externally using Nginx so after putting my external domain I could access but every time I turned off or went out of jellyfin I had to the re-login, even with the signed in automatically option marked. The second error and more critical is that it can't play any video file, it would start and show the blue circle animation but will get stuck in there, no errors but the shield gets a bit unresponsive like if the CPU was at 100%. Checking in the server it shows the video progressing in the shield which is kind of weird. I couldn't find any errors. Probably not many people have updated the Shield but hopefully somebody else have the same issue. I'm using the last version, 0.9, published in the repo.

Issue.Title: Consolidate breakpoints
Issue.Description:
## 🚀 Feature Proposal
Consolidate breakpoints across the React and CSS kits and put them in the respective core modules as constants.
## Motivation
We have some inconsistent breakpoints that we should align on. Also it would be nice to have constants for breakpoints for consumers to depend on. This would make projects implemented with the Canvas Kits more consistent across the board.
This could also potentially be combined with the [`makeMq` helper](https://github.com/Workday/canvas-kit/blob/master/modules/common/react/lib/utils/makeMq.ts) for the React kit.

Issue.Title: Add developer guide
Issue.Description:
### Summary of Changes Addresses https://github.com/lyft/amundsen/issues/18.
This PR adds some documentation and a new `.yml` file for local development. At the moment, the local workflow we can support leverages using Docker to spin up all the necessary containers, just like in the installation. Some key pieces of information: 1. We needed a new `.yml` file that will build using the content in the local submodules, as opposed to an official tag. 2. I ran into some issues building `amundsenfrontendlibrary` with the `public.Dockerfile`, and created a separate `local.Dockerfile`. More details in https://github.com/lyft/amundsenfrontendlibrary/pull/246 for why this was needed.
There's a lot of room for improvement, specifically surrounding the fact that rebuilding local changes in `amundsen/amundsenfrontendlibrary` takes much longer than the others, it will take a bit more research for me to understand some ways we could cut that down. In addition, we still have to improve our dummy data for people to actually be able to use this to develop on top of existing features.
### Documentation
Added `docs/developer_guide.md`
### CheckList Make sure you have checked **all** steps below to ensure a timely review. - [x] PR title addresses the issue accurately and concisely. - [x] PR includes a summary of changes. - [x] I have squashed multiple commits if they address the same issue. In addition, my commits follow the guidelines from "[How to write a good git commit message](http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/)"

Issue.Title: When copying files during GCP & AWS error message provides incorrect details
Issue.Description:
/kind bug
**What steps did you take and what happened:** Run `kfctl init` then delete cluster.jinja from the `.cache` directory to simulate a bad cache download or misconfigured repo. You'll get an error message saying it cannot create a directory when you attempt run `kfctl generate`
**What did you expect to happen:**
I expected to get an error saying that the input path was not present.
**Anything else you would like to add:**
I ran into this when trying to test some unrelated changes which pointed to master which at the time was being extracted to the wrong place. With the correct message it would have been faster to debug. This is relatively minor
**Environment:**
- Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): df2b68d92cf15374b1706d3d91b8123972b8920c - kfctl version: (use `kfctl version`): - Kubernetes platform: (e.g. `minikube`) - Kubernetes version: (use `kubectl version`): - OS (e.g. from `/etc/os-release`): 18.04.2 LTS (Bionic Beaver)

Issue.Title: Wrong emulation of thumb BL instruction for large values
Issue.Description:
The arm reference defines the thumb bl instruction as such (T1 encoding)
``` Notes: ARMv4T, ARMv5T, ARMv6, ARMv7 if J1 == J2 == 1 ARMv6T2, ARMv7 otherwise
Encoding: BL1: | 11110 | S | imm10 | BL2: | 11 | J1 | 1 | J2 | imm11 |
The immediate is encoded as such: SignExtend(S:I1:I2:imm10:imm11:0)
With: - I1 = not(J1 ^ S) - I2 = not(J2 ^ S) ```
The documentation is confusing as it may let the user think that J1 and J2 must be equal to 1 at all times, which is not the case.
The problem is that mgba doesn't use the J1 and J2 value in the computation of the final address. The current implementation works for calls in a 4Mb range but not beyond (and as per the reference the supported range for this branch is 16Mb). For such jumps mgba will just jump over the call.
We can see this in action in this gist with the current implementation and the fixed one where only the large branch fails: https://gist.github.com/SiD3W4y/7f13922073a7c4470e3ab5704455d83d (even though BL1/BL2 are handled in isa-thumb.c, the computations are the same).
I tried to fix it myself but failed to find a way to cleanly do it as there are now collisions in the instruction lookup table (BL2 has 4 different encodings instead of one).

Issue.Title: [bug fix] delegate isIncludedInLayout to yoga vs using default value
Issue.Description: Currently the value of `isIncludedInLayout` may not reflect what the underlying yoga value is as the developer may have manipulated the `yoga` value directly. This could potentially leave the Flex initial value out of sync. This change defers the get/set of this property to yoga.

Issue.Title: Update Article “recruiting-app-redesign”
Issue.Description: Automatically generated by Netlify CMS

Issue.Title: Move Id to Operation<T> and hide CopyFromUriOperation
Issue.Description:
Move the `Id` property up to `Operation<T>` so we don't need to expose our own `CopyFromUriOperation` just to provide the `Id`.
Removing `CopyFromUriOperation` is a breaking change: **Before**: Use `CopyFromUriOperation` **After**: Use `Operation<long>`
@KrzysztofCwalina and @pakrym -- please weigh in on whether the `protected ctor` is fine or we'd rather have a settable property.
/fyi @seanmcc-msft @kfarmer-msft @amnguye

Issue.Title: Glossary still not linked
Issue.Description:
As I mentioned [here](https://github.com/raspberrypi/documentation/issues/801#issuecomment-500826570) there's still nothing linking to the glossary, so the _only_ way to find it is by directly typing in https://www.raspberrypi.org/documentation/glossary/ Opening an issue so that it doesn't get forgotten about...
Also, should the glossary mention EEPROM?

Issue.Title: Blargg Controller Strobe Behavior Test - Fails
Issue.Description:
Just wanted to inform that when performing one of Blargg's SNES Hardware Test ROMs, the Mesen-S emulator does not seem to report the correct Controller Strobe Behavior, and fails the test.
Both Bsnes/Higan, and Snes9x pass the test.
Test ROMs can be found here if needed: https://snescentral.com/homebrew.php
I know you have a webpage for your NES Accuracy: https://mesen.ca/#Accuracy Didn't know if there will be one for SNES.

Issue.Title: Swift compile for iOS
Issue.Description:
I need to compile AMCL for use on IOS but I'm getting an error while trying to do that.
``` Choose a Scheme to support - 0 to finish: 21 <unknown>:0: warning: using sysroot for 'MacOSX' but targeting 'iPhone' <module-includes>:1:9: note: in file included from <module-includes>:1: #import "DispatchOverlayShims.h" ^ /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/lib/swift/shims/DispatchOverlayShims.h:219:20: error: implicit conversion of C pointer type 'dispatch_data_t _Nonnull' (aka 'struct dispatch_data_s *') to Objective-C pointer type '__swift_shims_dispatch_data_t _Nonnull' (aka 'id') requires a bridged cast return applier(data, off, loc, size); ^ /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/lib/swift/shims/DispatchOverlayShims.h:219:20: note: use __bridge to convert directly (no change in ownership) return applier(data, off, loc, size); ^ /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/lib/swift/shims/DispatchOverlayShims.h:219:20: note: use __bridge_transfer to transfer ownership of a +1 'dispatch_data_t _Nonnull' (aka 'struct dispatch_data_s *') into ARC return applier(data, off, loc, size); ^ <unknown>:0: error: could not build Objective-C module '_SwiftDispatchOverlayShims' Traceback (most recent call last): File "config64.py", line 302, in <module> curveset("bls381","48","58","381","3","NOT_SPECIAL","WEIERSTRASS","BLS","M_TYPE","NEGATIVEX","65","128") File "config64.py", line 148, in curveset run_in_shell("swiftc amcl"+slashtext+"*.swift " + target + sysroot + "-O -Ounchecked -whole-module-optimization -emit-library -emit-module -module-name amcl") File "config64.py", line 21, in run_in_shell subprocess.check_call(cmd, shell=True) File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.4/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 347, in check_call raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd) subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command 'swiftc amcl/*.swift -target x86_64-apple-ios12.2-simulator -Fsystem /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS.sdk -O -Ounchecked -whole-module-optimization -emit-library -emit-module -module-name amcl' returned non-zero exit status 1.
```
Since the error is in a Swift library I'm not sure how to proceed. I have XCode 10.3 installed which is the latest version. As an alternative I added the source files to my Swift project and used them without building the .dylib but it would be nice to know that the library build process works if we need it.
In the next-to-last line of output you can see that I added `-Fsystem /Applications/.../iPhoneOS.sdk` but I'm still getting the sysroot warning in the first line.
I added the amcl files to an existing XCode project designed to build a .dylib and it worked after adding "public" on all methods and adding header files such as BIG.h. Although it would be nice to get the current compilation method working another alternative would be to use a `.xcodeproj` file for configuration and call `xcodebuild` in the config script.

Issue.Title: include extracted front matter in token
Issue.Description:
markdown-it provides token.meta as a namespace for plugins to pass along arbitrary data- this commit makes the fully extracted front matter in the token so authors can extract and use front matter in the scope of the rendering process, vs only having global access.
my use case is to write a custom renderer for front_matter tokens that just takes the fully extracted front matter (without the fences) and includes it in the env namespace used during the lifecycle of the render.
Thanks for the plugin!

Issue.Title: control instructions unclear (touchscreen)
Issue.Description:
##### Minetest version ```5.0.1```
##### OS / Hardware Operating system: Android 5.1.1 Resolution: 800x480 (72 DPI)
##### Summary there are no clear instructions as to how to properly use the inventory. in special, i am struggling to separate units of items from stacks, as i can't seem to know how to figure out the controls. clicking and dragging is simple enough, but that only moves and appends stacks.
maybe implementing persistent instructions or actual control buttons (which we can also move around in the settings) can help making it easier to figure out the controls?
thank you for the help :3
(edit: maybe i should have posted this issue as a feature request...)

Issue.Title: Cancel for Checkouter/Ingester, implement for bztree
Issue.Description: We needed a way to cleanup stuck fs_util operations that happen as underlying calls during Checkout/Ingest for Bazel tasks, as these were left running previously. Add a Cancel interface and implement in BzFiler (in bzCommand). Run fs_util via an OsExecer so that we can abort it on Cancel().

Issue.Title: Restauration via Samba
Issue.Description:
Lors de la restauration d'un backup distant via Samba le backup distant est bien vu par Nextdom dans les sauvegardes disponibles mais lorsque l'on clique sur 'Restaurer la sélection' en ayant choisi la liste le backup à restaurer un message d'erreur apparaît 'le fichier est introuvable sur le serveur Samba: nomdubackup.tar.gz'
PS : ce n'est pas un problème de droits sur le serveur samba PS2 : la sauvegarde en samba (sur le même serveur) fonctionne parfaitement
Étapes pour reproduire le problème : 1. Aller dans 'Sauvegardes 2. Sélectionner un backup dans la liste de la partie 'Sauvegardes Samba' 3. Cliquer sur 'Restaurer la sélection'
**Screenshots** ![Restore Samba](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51484329/62255591-26786400-b3fe-11e9-8e81-c8b6f6693cb5.gif)
**Information matérielles** - OS : Debian 9.9 - Navigateur : chrome - Version NextDom : 0.3.0 - Branche NextDom : master - Installé via : paquet deb

Issue.Title: feat(notifications): Add notifications for decisions.
Issue.Description:
# Summary - Introduces notification center and manager for handling notifications internally in a consistent way - Each top-level component can offer hooks for developers to subscribe to, as shown with the `CompositeService`
Due to the lack of generics in Go, I've opted to use the only generic construct available, which is `interface{}`. The notification center and manager don't really care about what payload gets sent back and forth. In this implementation, the component that houses the notification center will take care of type-casting the payload to a type-specific notification that will be sent back to the caller.
This is WIP as I am trying to get early feedback on it.
# Tests - Unit tests

Issue.Title: app crashes when press confirm on deposit dialog without entering value
Adjust "added to queue" message to show how many in the queue every 3 seconds
Add definitions for normalization and scoring
Issue.Description:
Preview link: https://review.docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/machine-learning/resources/glossary?branch=pr-en-us-13676
Fixes #10846
[AB#1572600](https://dev.azure.com/mseng/677da0fb-b067-4f77-b89b-f32c12bb8617/_workitems/edit/1572600)

Issue.Title: Teach solana-install about release channels
Issue.Description:
```bash $ solana-install init edge # <-- setup an install using the edge channel $ solana-install update # <-- update to the latest edge channel release ```
This makes it so much easier to test drive the latest edge/beta binaries

Issue.Title: Moved route to assignments for creating assignment
New PR to test SignCLA at 2019-07-31 16:46:31.783922856 -0700 PDT m=+838482.492940066
Issue.Description: Body of PR

Issue.Title: Add Gotham font to Font enum
Issue.Description: The Gotham font that is exposed in the Font enum (https://developer.roblox.com/en-us/api-reference/enum/Font) is missing in Lemur.

Issue.Title: An in-range update of documentation is breaking the build 🚨
Issue.Description:
## The devDependency [documentation](https://github.com/documentationjs/documentation) was updated from `12.0.3` to `12.1.0`. 🚨 [View failing branch](https://github.com/Kronos-Integration/interceptor-gzip/compare/master...Kronos-Integration:greenkeeper%2Fdocumentation-12.1.0). This version is **covered** by your **current version range** and after updating it in your project **the build failed**. documentation is a devDependency of this project. It **might not break your production code or affect downstream projects**, but probably breaks your build or test tools, which may **prevent deploying or publishing**.
Status Details - ❌ **continuous-integration/travis-ci/push:** The Travis CI build failed ([Details](https://travis-ci.org/Kronos-Integration/interceptor-gzip/builds/566233458?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification)).
---
Commits

The new version differs by 2 commits.

  • 43cd57d chore(release): 12.1.0
  • ec36b41 feat: Add git submodules support to github linking (#1270)

See the full diff

Issue.Title: Promise and Flow
Update distributed to 2.2.0
Issue.Description:
This PR updates [distributed](https://pypi.org/project/distributed) from **1.23.2** to **2.2.0**.
*The bot wasn't able to find a changelog for this release. [Got an idea?](https://github.com/pyupio/changelogs/issues/new)*
<details> <summary>Links</summary>
- PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/distributed - Homepage: https://distributed.dask.org </details>

Issue.Title: Fix MaxScriptManager::Export() NullReference exception
Issue.Description:
Fixing null reference exception when executing MaxScriptManager. Changed MaxScriptManager ExportParameters to use MaxExportParameters structure.

Issue.Title: [Security] Bump tough-cookie from 2.3.2 to 2.3.4
Issue.Description:
Bumps [tough-cookie](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie) from 2.3.2 to 2.3.4. **This update includes security fixes.**
Vulnerabilities fixed *Sourced from The GitHub Security Advisory Database.* > **High severity vulnerability that affects tough-cookie** > A ReDoS (regular expression denial of service) flaw was found in the tough-cookie module before 2.3.3 for Node.js. An attacker that is able to make an HTTP request using a specially crafted cookie may cause the application to consume an excessive amount of CPU. > > Affected versions: < 2.3.3 *Sourced from The GitHub Security Advisory Database.* > **High severity vulnerability that affects tough-cookie** > A ReDoS (regular expression denial of service) flaw was found in the tough-cookie module before 2.3.3 for Node.js. An attacker that is able to make an HTTP request using a specially crafted cookie may cause the application to consume an excessive amount of CPU. > > Affected versions: <2.3.3
Commits - [`e4dfb0a`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/e4dfb0aec5d25e9e982805417a5d936071badc17) 2.3.4 - [`7d66ffd`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/7d66ffde12af5cbad40c3642f3c339fa82e6e381) Update public suffix list - [`7564c06`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/7564c0637e6674d8847a1b84979536930eb9b170) Merge pull request [#100](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/issues/100) from salesforce/no-re-parser - [`751da6d`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/751da6dadfeddb916b7dc5f524715afd4b02969c) Document removal of 256 space limit - [`8452ccd`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/8452ccdf02853fb011a5f654f206a698a659889a) Convert date-time parser from regexp, expand tests - [`8614dbf`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/8614dbf439d3eee71a32ff4a5ae9fad7a562d7c2) More String#repeat polyfill - [`2a4775c`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/2a4775c28f88c794b9ca05533b5537b7be6d7395) Avoid unbounded Regexp parts in date parsing - [`c9bd79d`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/c9bd79dd358ec8bb7ea82bea328b2449168736fc) Parse cookie-pair part without regexp - [`12d4266`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/12d426678f77bd34dd1234b7acbf47b299f50439) 2.3.3 - [`98e0916`](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/commit/98e0916d7b017669c93855d831c6e0b19c14141e) Merge pull request [#97](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/issues/97) from salesforce/spaces-ReDoS - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/compare/v2.3.2...v2.3.4)

Issue.Title: Dataset for theme decks
Issue.Description:
I'm using this API for a project I'm working on and was looking for a way to also track the theme decks. I've started building the dataset myself, figured I'd post here and see if there's any interest in it being PR'd when I'm done. No idea when that will be though.
The data model I'm using looks roughly like this - open to feedback and any information others might also want to see. The id naming convention is also open to change, I just picked something unique.
```json [ { "id": "d-base1-1", "name": "Overgrowth", "cards": [ { "id": "base1-44", "count": 4 }, { "id": "base1-30", "count": 2 }, { "id": "base1-69", "count": 4 }, { "id": "base1-33", "count": 2 }, { "id": "base1-17", "count": 1 }, { "id": "base1-65", "count": 4 }, { "id": "base1-64", "count": 3 }, { "id": "base1-35", "count": 2 }, { "id": "base1-6", "count": 1 }, { "id": "base1-91", "count": 2 }, { "id": "base1-93", "count": 2 }, { "id": "base1-94", "count": 1 }, { "id": "base1-90", "count": 2 }, { "id": "base1-95", "count": 2 }, { "id": "base1-99", "count": 16 }, { "id": "base1-102", "count": 12 } ] } ] ```

Issue.Title: Use MySQL with AWS RDS
Issue.Description:
### Description For utterance recording, there's a data structure that is saved in a local mysql instance and an audio file that goes to S3. We should keep storing the files under S3, but the recordings data should go to a centralized database.
For that, please use AWS RDS for MySQL, so that we have the data stored in the cloud.

Issue.Title: [Security] Bump tar from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2
Issue.Description:
Bumps [tar](https://github.com/npm/node-tar) from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2. **This update includes a security fix.**
Vulnerabilities fixed *Sourced from The GitHub Security Advisory Database.* > **High severity vulnerability that affects tar** > A vulnerability was found in node-tar before version 4.4.2. An Arbitrary File Overwrite issue exists when extracting a tarball containing a hardlink to a file that already exists on the system, in conjunction with a later plain file with the same name as the hardlink. This plain file content replaces the existing file content. > > Affected versions: < 2.2.2
Commits - [`523c5c7`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/523c5c7fef48b10811fccd12b42803c61b6aead8) 2.2.2 - [`7ecef07`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/7ecef07da6a9e72cc0c4d0c9c6a8e85b6b52395d) Bump fstream to fix hardlink overwriting vulnerability - [`9fc84b9`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/9fc84b9c596c3589d4c1ab050843de0eafb002e8) Use {} for hardlink tracking instead of [] - [`15e59f1`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/15e59f1d671ffbe4ae7c74dafcbec93ea2584e34) Only track previously seen hardlinks - [`4f85851`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/4f8585178af78f8f64c5ca38e923c306613278b9) Ignore potentially unsafe files - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/compare/v2.2.1...v2.2.2)

Issue.Title: [Security] Bump tar from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2
Issue.Description:
Bumps [tar](https://github.com/npm/node-tar) from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2. **This update includes a security fix.**
Vulnerabilities fixed *Sourced from The GitHub Security Advisory Database.* > **High severity vulnerability that affects tar** > A vulnerability was found in node-tar before version 4.4.2. An Arbitrary File Overwrite issue exists when extracting a tarball containing a hardlink to a file that already exists on the system, in conjunction with a later plain file with the same name as the hardlink. This plain file content replaces the existing file content. > > Affected versions: < 2.2.2
Commits - [`523c5c7`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/523c5c7fef48b10811fccd12b42803c61b6aead8) 2.2.2 - [`7ecef07`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/7ecef07da6a9e72cc0c4d0c9c6a8e85b6b52395d) Bump fstream to fix hardlink overwriting vulnerability - [`9fc84b9`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/9fc84b9c596c3589d4c1ab050843de0eafb002e8) Use {} for hardlink tracking instead of [] - [`15e59f1`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/15e59f1d671ffbe4ae7c74dafcbec93ea2584e34) Only track previously seen hardlinks - [`4f85851`](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/4f8585178af78f8f64c5ca38e923c306613278b9) Ignore potentially unsafe files - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/compare/v2.2.1...v2.2.2)

Issue.Title: How do you change the URL for presigned get object?
Issue.Description:
Hey,
I'm running minio on k8s (with Traefik as my reverse proxy) when I create a presigned URL I get `http://minio.test.svc:9000/delivery/` where as I want `https://example.com/delivery`. I don't think its clear in any of the docs how to configure this properly. Or to put it another way, I want minio to generate a internet routable URL with the proper protocol (SSL) for my presigned URL.
From reading the docs I'm not sure if `MINIO_DOMAIN` and virtual-domains `https://delivery.example.com/` are meant for this scenario or for distributing workload (federated setup).
Any help is appreciated.

Issue.Description:
Bumps [stringstream](https://github.com/mhart/StringStream) from 0.0.5 to 0.0.6. **This update includes security fixes.**
Vulnerabilities fixed *Sourced from [The Node Security Working Group](https://github.com/nodejs/security-wg/blob/master/vuln/npm/422.json).* > **Out-of-bounds Read** > `stringstream` allocates uninitialized Buffers when number is passed in input stream on Node.js 4.x and below > > Affected versions: <=0.0.5 *Sourced from [The Node Security Working Group](https://github.com/nodejs/security-wg/blob/master/vuln/npm/422.json).* > **Out-of-bounds Read** > `stringstream` allocates uninitialized Buffers when number is passed in input stream on Node.js 4.x and below > > Affected versions: <=0.0.5

Issue.Title: do crashstats-tools work on Windows?
Issue.Description:
I wrote and tested it on Linux. Because of that, it's likely it works on MacOS, too. However, I have not used it on Windows. I don't have much experience with how people use command line programs on Windows.
This issue covers figuring out how that works.

Issue.Title: rotate J4
Issue.Description: The J4 footprint should be rotated so that the pin 1 mark agrees with the mark on the header and on ribbon cables. The connections should be rotated in the schematic as well so that all the traces can stay where they are.

Issue.Title: Fix TypeScript Module Bundling
Issue.Description:
- use peer dependencies - prepare module for lerna inclusion (remove release scripts) - add docs to root dir - add tests for react and node of typescript module bundle
These changes should only be element-core module and element-module tests.
The idea is to include element-core as a dependency of element-lib, and slowly move element-lib to element core, adding type-safety and documentation as we go.

Issue.Title: feat: follow symlinks for directory detection
Send date is in the future, but it's not.
Issue.Description:
When trying to add a received or sent letter fds will ask for a send date. I've created the foia request today (=01.08.2019). When entering 01.08.2019 as the date it says that my date is in the future:
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10353467/62255407-5bd08200-b3fd-11e9-8273-7f916f87c73b.png)
When entering 31.07.2019 as the date it works. When entering 30.07.2019 as the date it rightfully complains that the date is before the request creation date.

Issue.Title: Update backed for a submissions bug fix (for real)
New firmware appears to have locked out tuya-convert
Issue.Description:
I'm flashing some new gosund wp3's and have been getting indications that they have patched out tuya-converts flash vectors.
Instead of having a hard coded ip address of 10.42.42.42 the device picks up a DHCP address. I bypassed this by resetting the DHCP pool to 10.42.42.41-42, connected my phone and then connected the smart plug. The plug picks up the .42 address, then immediately gets a port 80 connection refused error.
This system was new from box, had not been connected to tuya.

Issue.Title: Update github.com/nlopes/slack and use converstations.list API
Issue.Description:
The `channels.list` and `groups.list` Slack APIs are deprecated and have a number of caveats. `conversations.list` is Slack's supported API to list public and private channels.
There have been a number of breaking changes in nlopes/slack that required touching many areas of the code. I've done my best to keep all logic the same but can't guarantee there aren't unintentional changes.
I also added printing of the channel names to IDs during startup. I think this will help diagnose issues with posting to channels in the future. I believe the previous issue with the now removed `#golang_cls` logic was that it's ID wasn't being returned by `groups.list` and the bot was attempting to send to a channel of `""`. Either that or the channel has been deleted/archived, it's is/was private so I can't tell. This is based on a log message from the previous version: ``` gerrit.go:196: Error Posting Message to : channel_not_found ```
I saw similar message from the GoTimeFM logic: ``` gotimefm.go:54: got error while notifying slack: channel_not_found ```

Issue.Title: [Security] Bump sshpk from 1.13.0 to 1.16.1
Issue.Description:
Bumps [sshpk](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk) from 1.13.0 to 1.16.1. **This update includes security fixes.**
Vulnerabilities fixed *Sourced from The GitHub Security Advisory Database.* > **Moderate severity vulnerability that affects sshpk** > The sshpk NPM package is vulnerable to ReDoS when parsing crafted invalid public keys. > > Affected versions: < 1.13.2 *Sourced from [The Node Security Working Group](https://github.com/nodejs/security-wg/blob/master/vuln/npm/401.json).* > **Denial of Service** > `sshpk` is vulnerable to ReDoS when parsing crafted invalid public keys > > Affected versions: <=1.13.1
Release notes *Sourced from [sshpk's releases](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/releases).* > ## v1.16.1 > * Fixes for [#60](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/60) (correctly encoding certificates with expiry dates >=2050), [#62](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/62) (accepting PKCS#8 EC private keys with missing public key parts) > > ## v1.16.0 > * Add support for SPKI fingerprints, PuTTY PPK format (public-key only for now), PKCS#8 PBKDF2 encrypted private keys > * Fix for [#48](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/48) > > ## v1.15.2 > * New API for accessing x509 extensions in certificates > * Fixes for [#52](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/52), [#50](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/joyent/node-sshpk/issues/50) > > ## v1.14.1 > * Remove all remaining usage of jodid25519 (abandoned dep) > * Add support for DNSSEC key format > * Add support for Ed25519 keys in PEM format (according to draft-curdle-pkix) > * Fixes for X.509 encoding issues (asn.1 NULLs in RSA certs, cert string type mangling) > * Performance issues parsing long SSH public keys
Commits - [`1aece0d`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/1aece0d1df155e60e4cb0ae42cb3ed7aa043e174) joyent/node-sshpk#60 certs should generate GeneralizedTime values for dates >... - [`684dbe6`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/684dbe66d9615378bdb4d1ac1ede9f901591cb86) joyent/node-sshpk#62 handle pkcs8 ECDSA keys with missing public parts - [`574ff21`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/574ff21e77117b478baf4664856bfc4b0aa41a12) joyent/node-sshpk#18 support for PKCS8 encrypted private keys - [`f647cf2`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/f647cf22c3258ef514d2ba098a4a6aad3492f425) joyent/node-sshpk#27 Add support for PuTTY PPK format - [`44aec4a`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/44aec4ad8bcf7324009c92a52e4c81487cbc24b9) joyent/node-sshpk#59 want support for SPKI fingerprint format - [`385ff11`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/385ff11efc4edd201c07f2ceee23746c13122f9c) joyent/node-sshpk#48 wish: add support for x509 certificates in text form - [`c7a6c68`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/c7a6c6833370f69322c47e73e9f4cfdedaf4e8f4) joyent/node-sshpk#58 des-ede3-cbc encrypted keys broken - [`2ab4f2a`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/2ab4f2a018766559252f2c3426a3735f0860ac0d) joyent/node-sshpk#56 md5 fingerprints not quite right - [`026ef47`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/026ef4764a55648dd15f45f7f14ff9da5d1fe2ad) joyent/node-sshpk#53 stop using optional deps to fix webpack - [`53e23fe`](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/commit/53e23feff41226826b45293bc4a9fc45f2e44afe) joyent/node-sshpk#50 Support PKCS#5 AES-256-CBC encrypted private keys - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/joyent/node-sshpk/compare/v1.13.0...v1.16.1)

Issue.Title: CI/CD pipeline examples: GCP, AWS and Azure infra stacks in GitLab, ArgoCD, Jenkins
Issue.Description:
Provide working examples and associated blog posts describing how to integrate Crossplane into various CI/CD pipelines for continuous deployment of Kubernetes apps and the cloud services they depend on.
Part of the [0.3 release](https://github.com/crossplaneio/crossplane/blob/master/ROADMAP.md#v03---enable-partners-to-build-infra-stacks)
### Why? What problem are we solving? Crossplane simplifies k8s app deployments into different target environments (dev, test, prod) that often use their own networks, subnets, k8s clusters, cloud services, credentials, and security configuration.
For shared environments supporting multiple app teams, it can save a lot of time & work to configure each target environment once (networks, subnets, target k8s clusters, cloud service provisioners, cloud credentials) esp. since it can take several minutes to provision k8s clusters on demand and esp. in dev/test environments the k8s apps & cloud service instances are often ephemeral and transient in nature.
Even when an app team owns their own target environments (dev/test/prod) and k8s clusters, there are often multiple developers on a team sharing a (dev/test) cluster, and k8s app deployments (with cloud services) are frequently torn down (from-scratch vs. in-place upgrades) and the deployed k8s app instances need to be rapidly cycled as new commits land on master or changes are promoted.
Even if you're the only developer on an app and you have your own target environments (dev/test/prod) that you exclusively own and manage you probably don't want the time hit of k8s target cluster creation every time you cycle your k8s app deployment with cloud services in dev/test. So even then configuring your target environments once and rapidly cycling your k8s app instances is desirable.
So there are 2 primary problems: (1) config of target environments (networks, subnets, target k8s clusters, ...), to support (2) rapid deploy & reclaim k8s apps and cloud service dependencies in dev/test and maybe prod.
It's often considered a best practice to have these configurations stored 'as code' in a VCS, and then have changes committed trigger a traditional CI/CD pipeline like Jenkins or GitLab or have a GitOps style flow that polls Git and synchronizes desired state (e.g. WeaveWorks Flux, Google Anthos, etc).
So as a Crossplane user: * How should I use Crossplane infra stacks and app stacks from my CI/CD pipeline of choice? * Is there an example I can use to get started quickly? * Should I use kubectl apply <yaml> or are is there a CLI tool I should use instead (e.g. to build, publish, and then apply stacks)?
### What does it look like when we're done? For (Jenkins pipeline, GitLab pipeline, GitOps flow)x(GCP, AWS, Azure stacks): * Blog describing how Crossplane should be used and working examples I can copy to: * configure target environments: * networks, subnets, target k8s clusters, default resource classes, credentials, etc. * rapidly cycle k8s app instances with cloud services * no app stacks, using resource claims only * with app stacks, pushing new app stack version * upgrading (in-place) * redeploying app instance (from-scratch) * Split into separate epic? Dogfood repo/pipeline is set up and running to implement a true GitOps continuous delivery scenario. Some infrastructure and application is deployed and managed entirely from this GitOps pipeline. Mattermost. config repo. pipelines all setup in that repo. first time pipeline runs it spins up Mattermost, which exists, then change to repo, edit some config, pipeline runs and updates the real matter most server in the wild. Live up-and-running instance controlled and configured by GitOps pipeline and repo. * Crossplane enhancements to improve CI/CD pipeline UX as required
### How could this be demonstrated?
1. Crossplane user reads the blog post describing this new functionality 1. Click through to the updated user guide 1. Try out the updated example(s) 1. View the dogfood GitOps CD pipeline as a real functional example
For (Jenkins pipeline, GitLab pipeline, GitOps flow)x(GCP stack, AWS stack, Azure stack): * Read blog, follow examples, demonstrate using Crossplane infra & apps stacks
### Releases: - v0.4.0 - 887 - 890 - change controller runtime to use resolveDep; for each stack add new type for each type being referenced. not too much work required. - #905 update services guides and stacks setup guides to reflect `kubectl apply -f` technique, sample infra & app repos - v0.5.0 - continuous deployment examples for GitLab, ArgoCD, Jenkins ### Related: - [ ] One pager for Cross Resource Referencing #707, #874 - Implement Cross Resource Referencing - [ ] Crossplane runtime #887 - [ ] Crossplane core #948 - [ ] GCP resource types #888 - [ ] AWS resource types #889 - [ ] Azure resource types #890 - [ ] Update crossplane.io services guides and stacks guides to reflect `kubectl apply -f` technique, w/ working sample infra and app repos - #905 - Write a user guide to use a gitops CI/CD system for Crossplane infra and app repositories - GitLab #886 - [ ] GCP (ETA Oct 11) - [ ] AWS - [ ] Azure - ArgoCD #904 - [ ] GCP - [ ] AWS - [ ] Azure - Jenkin #902 - [ ] GCP - [ ] AWS - [ ] Azure
- Good to have: - [ ] Static provisioning by app developers - [ ] Immutable fields #727

Issue.Title: Fix NavView VisualState for pane closing
Issue.Description:
Fixes #726.
When m_initialListSizeStateSet is set to true, NavView skips list size VisualState updates in NavigationView::UpdateIsClosedCompact, which causes this PaneCustomContent layout updating bug when pane open/closes. Set m_initialListSizeStateSet to false before closing NavView pane to fix the issue.

A review is needed as there is a surprising issue as I tried both URLs https://results.openaddresses.io/latest/run/fr/seien_et_marne.zip and https://results.openaddresses.io/latest/run/fr/seine_et_marne.zip The first one is working while it should not and the content size is different between both URLs to zip...

Issue.Title: major updates, including more ui options and details about each robot
The chat service will now auto-announce live-coders team members. Closes #41
Issue.Description:
# Purpose
There was a question / feature request to have the chatbot auto announce live-coder team members. This PR seeks to solve that feature request.
# How it works
> DISCLAIMER: Unfortunately the 'Helix' Twitch APIs do not have an endpoint to retrieve Twitch Team information. However, the 'Kraken' APIs do have an endpoint. Although 'Kraken' is deprecated, I felt it was Ok to use it's API because 'Helix' has no alternative and Kraken still works today.
1. **chron** service starts, then waits 15 seconds and calls the **api** service for the live-coders team information. 2. **api** service sends a request to the Kraken API for information on the live-coders team. 3. **api** service receives the response from the Kraken API ~~and sends the information over the Socket.~~ and sends a response payload back to the **chron** service with the results. 4. ~~**hub** service listens for the event, pulls out the 'users' array from the live-coders team then re-submits the information over its io socket.~~ **chron** pulls out the team member data from and posts the information to the **user** service to update the live-coders team members. 5. ~~**chat** service listens for the event and saves the list of members in memory as `liveCodersTeamMembers`.~~ **user** service listens for the post and fires off a request to the **api** service to get the twitch user information from the **helix** api in batches of 100. The **api** service sends a response payload back to the **user** service with the gathered information. 6. ~~**chat** service listens for 'chat' events and checks the user against the `liveCodersTeamMembers` list, and if the individual both exists on the team AND has not already been announce for this stream, **chat** will send out a shoutout.~~ **user** service updates the users `liveCodersTeamMember` and saves the record in the database and to the cache.
Closes #41

Issue.Title: Remove Password
Issue.Description:
The startup password can simply be removed
You just go to the "SAMSettings" and find "PasswordProtect" make it = false and gg no password
